<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Sorcerer Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=734) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
<trait label="Multiclass" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=115" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 230 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Sorcerer](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=11)

**Prerequisites**
Charisma 14

</column>

---

Choose a [bloodline](/classes/sorcerer/bloodlines). You become trained in the bloodline's two skills; for each of these skills in which you were already trained, you become trained in a skill of your choice.

 You cast spells like a sorcerer. You gain access to the Cast a Spell activity. You gain a spell repertoire with two common cantrips from the spell list associated with your bloodline, from the spells granted by your bloodline, or any other cantrips of that tradition you learn or discover. You're trained in spell attack rolls and spell DCs for your tradition's spells. Your key spellcasting ability for sorcerer archetype spells is Charisma, and they are sorcerer spells of your bloodline's tradition. You don't gain any other abilities from your choice of bloodline.

**Special** You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the sorcerer archetype.

<title level="2">Sorcerer Dedication leads to...</title>
[Basic Blood Potency](/Feats.aspx?ID=736), [Basic Bloodline Spell](/Feats.aspx?ID=737), [Basic Sorcerer Spellcasting](/Feats.aspx?ID=735)
name: Sorcerer Dedication
